description:
Based on an anime RPG smartphone game by Cygames.

Set in the lovely land of Astoria where a gentle wind blows, Princess Connect! Re:Dive follows the adventures of: Yuuki, an amnesiac young man; Kokkoro, a small guide who looks after Yuuki; Pecorine, a beautiful swordswoman who is constantly hungry; and Karyl, a cat-eared magical girl with a somewhat cool personality. These fateful four form a guild entitled "Bishoku-den" ("Epicurean Hall") and embark on delicious adventures together.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: ปรินเซส คอนเนค รี: ไดฟ์

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description: **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/121710864)**
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanyasaki)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanyasaki)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/zzy_yamaguchi)

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shun_do)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanyasaki)
Kimura Kashiko is an editor working for Mad Box.
Affiliated with [Bibury Animation CG](https://anilist.co/studio/7006).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1189754972) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/bushi2424.bsky.social) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2415493) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=takeshi_maenami)

He has gathered a lot of attention with his incredibly dynamic, [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/)-inspired cuts in [Pokémon Sun & Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/97634/). His animation is characterized by erratic snappy timing, liberal and ample use of smears (often with a complete lack of outlines), and extreme perspectives. 

Graduated Yoyogi Animation School in 2009, but spent much of the following years helping out at his parents' restaurant and didn't start formally working as an animator until 2018. Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

**Height:** 158 cm
**Agency:** Yellow Cab Next

[Profile](http://www.yellow-cab-next.jp/mao-ichimichi.html)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Snow White - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Luka Millfy - Kaizoku Sentai Gokaiger (TV Series)
- Raptor 283 - Uchuu Sentai Kyuuranger (TV Series)
- Varesa - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Celestia - Strinova (VG)

[Profile (Style Cube)](http://stylecube.jp/talents/miku/index.html) | [Profile (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/itomiku/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/itou-miku/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/InfoItomiku) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/itomiku_official/) | [LINE](https://page.line.me/itomiku_official) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miku_Itō) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤美来)

Miku joined the idol unit [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177) on April 27, 2013 and is one half of its subunit, [Pyxis](https://anilist.co/staff/139753), along with [Moe Toyota](https://anilist.co/staff/118398). 

Miku's hobbies include watching anime, dancing, and playing Hyakunin Isshu. She also practices kendo (but is at the lowest level) and enjoys acting. She is a fan of Kamen Rider, and her favorite rider is Den-O.

**Non-anime roles:**
• Fu Xuan - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
• Olivia - Memento Mori (VG)
• Kolulu - Granblue Fantasy (VG)
• Indomitable - Azur Lane (VG)
• Liv - Punishing: Gray Raven (VG)
• Agnès Claudel - Kiseki Series (VG)

**Height:** 155cm

**[Website](http://www.teichiku.co.jp/artist/tachibana-rika/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RiccaTachibana)**

__[Profile (Imagine)](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/10)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Takayuki Negishi__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer, arranger and music producer affiliated with Imagine Music, better known for his composition work on several anime, such as; the hit magical girl TV series Cardcaptor Sakura, Tokyo Mew Mew and Mnemosyne. He began working in the industry as a synthesizer operator in 1983, before he later became a composer. He also produces music for several  artists like Mariko Nagai and Hiroko Moriguchi.
Website | Twitter | Facebook | Instagram __Shihori Nakane__, alternatively known as Shihori, is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and arranger.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenokun)

Kouhei attended Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music (Music Faculty, Composition Department), studying under Tomojirou Ikenouchi and other professors. He worked for three consecutive years at Victor Music Industries after he graduated from the University. He attended Berklee College of Music for two years after he left Victor Music Industries. After returning to Japan, Kouhei started his activities as a composer.

Though Kouhei had been playing at the hotel at first, he was requested to compose an insert song for "Arcadia of My Youth: Endless Orbit SSX", a 1982 TV anime, and it became his first work as a composer. Afterwards, he handled some more compositions of insert songs, this time for the Super Sentai series and he also did the composition of the background music for a TV anime, Konpora Kid, in 1985.

Notably, the score for [Top wo Nerae! Gunbuster](https://anilist.co/anime/949/) made his name and talent very famous among anime fans, and is recognized as one of his most important works. He also handled the composition of [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/) and showed a peculiar arrangement, which he added to his previous 17-year-old work. Another of his most important work is often said to be [Yuusha-Ou GaoGaiGar](https://anilist.co/anime/890/), and the [sequel](https://anilist.co/anime/1382/) following it.

In 2002, he won the first Tokyo Anime Award for Best Music for his work on [Overman King Gainer](https://anilist.co/anime/1792/).

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/ryosei-sato/)__

__Date of Birth:__ ?? ??, 1978
__Birthplace:__ Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
